repnme.cdata!:
Malaysia - Economic Recovery and Social
            Sector Loan Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The outcome of the Economic Recovery and
            Social Sector Loan Project was assessed as satisfactory. Key
            lessons include: 1) Country knowledge must be maintained
            even if there is no lending activity. 2) Strong ownership of
            the reform program by the Government is crucial to its
            success. 3) The Bank should show flexibility in policy
            stance in the face of uncertainty and rapidly changing
            situation. 4) Fiscal flexibility requires increased
            coordination between Ministry of Finance and line agencies
            in order to implement the public sector programs. 5)
            Appropriate fiscal and monetary policies, measures to
            recapitalize the banking system, strengthening banking
            supervision, and corporate debt restructuring have played a
            key role in stemming capital outflows and returning
            stability to the Malaysian economy. 6) The crisis in
            Malaysia has brought out strongly the need to account for
            contingent liabilities arising out of Government guarantees.
            7) Some form of temporary regulatory easing may be
            appropriate during crisis times if it can be clearly
            demonstrated that these regulations are preventing banks
            from focusing on their key business. 8) Some open economies
            like Malaysia are vulnerable to boom and bust cycles and
            therefore need mechanisms to manage them effectively. 9)
            Economies like Malaysia need to develop a social sector
            strategy to manage the risks arising from globalization,
            especially mechanisms to reach the urban poor.

Malaysia - Economic Recovery and Social

5085940.majtheme: Economic management,Social protection and risk management,Financial and private sector development

repnme.cdata!:
Malaysia - Economic Recovery and Social
            Sector Loan Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The Economic Recovery and Social Sector
            Loan Project is designed to support the implementation of
            the Government's program of pre-emptive measures to: a)
            minimize the downturn of economic activity; b) implement
            policy reforms to resume robust and sustainable growth; c)
            expand safety nets to protect the hard core and the near
            poor from the adverse effects of the regional crisis; and d)
            protect investments in the human resources base. The loan
            will be disbursed in a single tranche of $300 million upon
            Board approval and effectiveness. The Government's will
            implement a series of structural reforms which are focused
            on four key areas: 1) Maintaining sound macroeconomic policy
            with flexibility in the light of uncertainties in the
            economic environment. 2) Strengthening the financial sector
            in the light of the regional crisis including consolidation
            of finance companies and pre-emptive recapitalization of
            viable banking institutions. 3) Improving competitiveness by
            strengthening corporate governance, enhancing transparency
            and disclosure of information. 4) Strengthening social
            safety nets to soften the negative impact of the economic
            crisis on the lower income and vulnerable groups. A key risk
            to the program is if the downturn in economic activity turns
            out to be greater than currently expected.
